snippet.textDisplay: Because of those games, it changed me alot and it made me less of an asshole. Seriously, the writing of P3, P4 and Catherine is fabulous and it's easy to relate to. I'm SO glad that my brother picked up Persona 3:FES and Persona 4. I also got myself Persona 3 Portable for the PSP and I kindly report that I do not regret one single bit of it.
snippet.textOriginal: Because of those games, it changed me alot and it made me less of an asshole. Seriously, the writing of P3, P4 and Catherine is fabulous and it's easy to relate to. I'm SO glad that my brother picked up Persona 3:FES and Persona 4. I also got myself Persona 3 Portable for the PSP and I kindly report that I do not regret one single bit of it.

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky I'm not much of a puzzle person myself either, but i'll tell you what these puzzles have you on your toes. They might be frustrating but there aren't really many "Oh thats bs" moments, but  just taking a moment to think about them they are easy enough to figure out, and a lot of the bosses are pretty..err...creepy I suppose is a good word, but you'll get why if you play the game. The story itself is absolutely amazing, one of the best ive seen. And the music is great without saying
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky I'm not much of a puzzle person myself either, but i'll tell you what these puzzles have you on your toes. They might be frustrating but there aren't really many "Oh thats bs" moments, but  just taking a moment to think about them they are easy enough to figure out, and a lot of the bosses are pretty..err...creepy I suppose is a good word, but you'll get why if you play the game. The story itself is absolutely amazing, one of the best ive seen. And the music is great without saying

snippet.textDisplay: Meh, Shoji Meguro has always been great with j-rock and electronica but his modem classical songs never have impressed me. He's not very good with an orchestra, rock is his strong suite. Mind you, this sounds pretty good. What's up with those trumpets, he just loves those huh? I've heard them used in Persona 3&4
snippet.textOriginal: Meh, Shoji Meguro has always been great with j-rock and electronica but his modem classical songs never have impressed me. snippet.textDisplay:
@SupraDarky It's an "adult drama".  The main character is being pestered by his girlfriend to settle down and marry, and one night gets caught up with a bombshell girl who's -not- his girlfriend, and shit starts going down; on top of that, he gets caught in nightmares which could kill him if he fails to escape.

It's... definitely something unique!
snippet.textOriginal:
@SupraDarky It's an "adult drama".  The main character is being pestered by his girlfriend to settle down and marry, and one night gets caught up with a bombshell girl who's -not- his girlfriend, and shit starts going down; on top of that, he gets caught in nightmares which could kill him if he fails to escape.

It's... definitely something unique!

snippet.textDisplay: @Smileoscar You weren't a jerk at all, it's fine. I was just curious.  It is ironic that you made that statement, though, because Americans are always derided and stereotyped as "Stupid Americans" when they assume that people from other countries know English... even though as you pointed out, it's extremely common.
snippet.textOriginal: @Smileoscar You weren't a jerk at all, it's fine. I was just curious.  It is ironic that you made that statement, though, because Americans are always derided and stereotyped as "Stupid Americans" when they assume that people from other countries know English... even though as you pointed out, it's extremely common.

snippet.textDisplay: This certainly looks like an interesting and unique game. I'll have to watch some videos though because I'm still not too sure what it's all about except it has puzzles. Music by Shoji Meguro is always a good thing though, so that's a part of the game I know I'll like.
